resources.string: We’ll make use of the Android ViewHolder pattern in our ListView.
The first time it was loaded, convertView is null. We’ll have to inflate our list item layout.
The second time it was loaded, convertView is not null, good! We don’t have to inflate it again.
The following times it was loaded, convertView is definitely not null.
Now we are going to code the smooth scrolling of our Android ListView.
In the previous post, we tried to understand how the ListView with adapter works.
The ViewHolder design pattern enables you to access each list item view without the need for the look up.
Okay, let’s dig it out and see how it works without the ViewHolder pattern.
The following time it was loaded, convertView is definitely not null.
For the sake of testing, we’re going to put thousands of items in our ListView.
